import ResponsiveColumns from './ResponsiveColumns?dev-site-examples';
import ResponsiveColumnsMaxWidth from './ResponsiveColumnsMaxWidth?dev-site-examples';

# Responsive Columns

### Description

This example demonstrates a [Compact Interactive List](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about) with responsive columns.

* The middle semantic column with the text information has [_flexGrow_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) prop set to `true` which allows it to grow to fill up the container's width.
* The maximum width for the text column is not limited, as the [_maximumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property is not set.
* The minimum width would take the default value as [_minimumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property is not set.
* Once the list reaches its minimum width, defined by fixed width columns and the default minimum width of the flex growing column, the scroll shows up.

<ResponsiveColumns />

### Usage

#### Creating a Responsive Column

There are two ways to make a sematic column responsive:

* Omitting the [_width_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) prop will make a semantic column grow or shrink to take all available space.
* Setting the [_flexGrow_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) prop to `true` with the [_width_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) set to a number will also make the column responsive. 
  Keeping [_width_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) is beneficial as it will be used as a [flex basis](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-basis).

#### Controlling Maximum and Minimum Width

* To control the minimum and maximum width of all flexible columns in the component, use
  [_columnMaximumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table) and 
  [_columnMinimumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table) props. 
  If [_columnMinimumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table) prop hasn't been set, the default value will be used.
* Alternatively, the [_minimumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) and [_maximumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) passed individually to a column, provides more flexibility. 

<Notice variant="important" ariaLevel="3">

The supported units for width props are `px`, `em`, and `rem`. 
The width units should be consistent across all the props in the same component. That includes:
[_columnMinimumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table), 
[_columnMaximumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table), 
[_width_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column), 
[_minimumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column), and 
[_maximumWidth_](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column).
The width units inconsistent with the rest of the component props will be disregarded.

</Notice>

In following example the text column has `maximumWidth: "400px"` and `minimumWidth: "200px"`:

<ResponsiveColumnsMaxWidth />
